Row.Text: The true nature of emptiness is the nature of no birth and no death. No being, no non-being.
The Heart Sūtra
A mortal ripens like corn, like corn he springs up again
The Katha Upanishad
Law is nothing other than the command of the sovereign in the exercise of his power.
Jean Bodin
O ye conquerors and your sons, O ye gurus and devas: Out of your great love, lead us along the Path.
The Tibetan Book of the Dead
The past is the treasure, time is its hiding place.
Gail Mazur
The life of the land is perpetuated in righteousness.
Kamehameha I
Do not mix the truth with falsehood or conceal the truth while you know it.
Ayat 42, the Holy Koran
Thou who dwell in the high heavens, among the tempest's clouds - accept our sacrifice.
Inca prayer to Viracocha
The echoes of our glory and our losses, of our victories and our disasters, have always resounded under those vaults.
André Chamson
I teach only suffering and the end of suffering.
The Buddha
Wherever you may be, death will overtake you. Even if you should be in towers of lofty construction.
The Quran
To be a king and wear a crown is a thing more glorious to them that see it than it is pleasant to them that bear it.
Elizabeth I
